meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I strung the lights on the Christmas tree.
meanings.sent2: She strung the beads together to make a beautiful necklace.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally strung the yarn all over the room.
meanings.sent4: His words were carefully strung together to form a persuasive argument.
meanings.sent5: The stars were strung across the night sky like diamonds on a velvet cloth.

meanings.definition: to stretch or extend in a line or series
meanings.sent1: The colorful flags were strung along the parade route.
meanings.sent2: The clothesline was strung between two trees in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly strung the excuses one after the other.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like music, strung out in the air.
meanings.sent5: The lights were strung out in a dazzling display, lighting up the night.

meanings.definition: to thread on a string or cord
meanings.sent1: She strung the popcorn for the Christmas garland.
meanings.sent2: He carefully strung the pearls onto the necklace.
meanings.sent3: The spider strung its web across the doorway.
meanings.sent4: The memories were strung together like beads on a necklace.
meanings.sent5: The words were strung on the page, forming a beautiful poem.
